headline: Environment Dozens Dead Winter Storm Hits Central Us Western Ny
summary: Dozens of deaths have been reported in western New York and across the Midwest amid severe winter weather.The Details:Over two-thirds of the U.S. population was under a winter weather advisory heading into the holiday weekend. The Buffalo, N.Y. area was hit with nearly 4 feet of snow, and local media reportedat least 27 weather-related deathsin the area. Several fatal car accidents were reported amid bad weather in Ohio, Kansas, and Missouri. And fromNew EnglandtoTennesseetoFlorida, temperatures were at or near record lows for the weekend. The weather also contributed to major travel disruptions, especially for Southwest Airlines, whichcancelled over 2,800 flightson Monday.How the Media Covered It:The storm continues to be a top story from news sources across the political spectrum. On Tuesday,NBC News (Lean Left bias)reported that63 people had diedacross the U.S. due to the weather.Updated 12/27/22 at 11:07 a.m. ET
